verb.description: (especially with reference to food) soften or become softened by soaking in a liquid.
examples: macerate the mustard seeds in vinegar
the fruit was allowed to macerate before fermentation

verb.description: Cause to grow thinner or waste away, especially by fasting.
examples: these men lodged in tombs and macerated themselves with fasting

origin: Mid 16th century: from Latin macerat- made soft, soaked, from macerare to soften.
